result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshante Terrell Wallace

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deshante Terrell Wallace in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Deshante Terrell Wallace.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case adjourned, Branch 30.

Defendant Deshante Terrell Wallace in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Deshante Terrell Wallace.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Case is tagging along with defendants other pending matter set for jury trial. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.

Defendant Deshante Terrell Wallace in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Deshante Terrell Wallace.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Discussion held. Defendant has a pending matter 21CM689 before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow. Case remains calendared in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.24.2022
Cash bail converted into signature bond. All other bail conditions previously ordered to apply.

Defendant Deshante Terrell Wallace in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Deshante Terrell Wallace in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deshante Terrell Wallace appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense filed a bail motion and asked for the cash bail in this case to be converted to a signature bond. 
For reasons placed on the record, motion is granted by the court. Cash bail to be converted to a signature bond. All other bail conditions previously ordered to apply. 
Defense recently appointed and requests time to discuss case with client.
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshante Terrell Wallace in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deshante Terrell Wallace appeared by video means.
Case in court for a pretrial conference. SPD has not appointed counsel at this time. Court adjourned matter for a status of counsel in Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court DOWN June 10, 2022.
PreTrial Conference RESCHEDULED for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am. 
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 622 of the Courthouse.

Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 4 SUPERVISION.
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered Defendant to have NO CONTACT with Myeasha S. or her residence.

NO CONTACT/NO FIREARMS ORDER; signed and filed.

Defendant Deshante Terrell Wallace in Court with Attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Deshante Terrell Wallace in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the Criminal Complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint, and advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserved Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case adjourned for PreTrial Conference in Branch 30. PreTrial Conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 622 of the Courthouse.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
